stories.text:
Is there any place on the web one can easily get the source code of the android operating system and modify it ..?
Or is it just locked up by Google?
stories.title: Source Code of Android Availabilty
New GriftHorse malware has infected more than 10M Android phones
Analyzing memory management and performance in Dask-on-Ray
Symphonia: A pure-Rust audio decoding/demuxing library
A small HOTP/TOTP SHA1 client written in C99, depending only on libcrypto
Face detection for my leaf blower

stories.text:
While there are lists of important publications in Computer Science [1] [2] [3], it appears that there are few or no blog posts on those lists.

What blog posts about Computer Science would you say are classics and should be widely read?

I'll add one:

"What Color Is Your Function?" by Bob Nystrom. [4]

[1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_important_publications_in_computer_science

[2]: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=9443028

[3]: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=27892076

[4]: https://journal.stuffwithstuff.com/2015/02/01/what-color-is-your-function/
stories.title: Ask HN: Classic Blog Posts About Computer Science
Extremists Flourishing Behind Well-Built Websites Built on Open Source Tech

stories.text:
The developer guide has been updated with details [1], and you can select the new architecture when creating a Lambda function through the AWS Console. We'll likely see an official statement from AWS soon.

[1]: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/foundation-arch.html
stories.title: AWS Lambda now supports ARM64 architecture
